intro: Carex hultenii, commonly known as Hultén's sedge, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb native to northern regions of North America, including parts of Canada and Alaska. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in open woodlands or wetlands. It has grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in spikelets. Carex hultenii is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local biodiversity.
